articles.author: Mike Rivero
articles.title: Canadian Public Broadcaster Claims Quebec Public Sector Employees ‘Too White’
articles.description: According to an investigation by the French language version of the publicly-funded Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC), the public sector workforce of the province of Quebec is “too white”. The investigation claims that white Canadians are overrepresente…

articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.title: Donald Trump: ‘Little’ Adam Schiff ‘One of the Biggest Liars and Leakers in Washington’
articles.description: “Little Adam Schiff, who is desperate to run for higher office, is one of the biggest liars and leakers in Washington, right up there with Comey, Warner, Brennan and Clapper!” Trump wrote on Twitter on Monday. “Adam leaves closed committee hearings to illegal…

articles.author: Breitbart Jerusalem
articles.title: US and Argentina to Work Together to Drain Hezbollah of Funding
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina — The United States and Argentina are to work together more closely to cut off Lebanese Hezbollah’s funding networks in Latin America, both nations’ top diplomats said Sunday.

articles.author: Virginia Hale
articles.title: German Politicians ‘Alarmed’ at Scale of Anti-Christian Hate Attacks
articles.description: Hate crime figures leaked by police in Germany have caused alarm, as they revealed murder, assault, and arson numbering among almost 100 attacks which targeted Christians in 2017.

articles.author: Thomas D. Williams, Ph.D.
articles.title: Leading German Cardinal Opens the Door to Church Blessings of Homosexual Couples
articles.description: In a controversial new statement, progressive German Cardinal Reinhard Marx said he could envision blessing homosexual couples in the Catholic Church, but added that it would have to be up to the “pastor on the ground” rather than made into a universal rule.

articles.author: Dylan Gwinn
articles.title: Philly Fans Celebrate Winning Super Bowl LII, by Trying to Burn Their City to the Ground
articles.description: Eagles fans reacted calmly and respectfully after their team won the Super Bowl on Sunday night. Just kidding, they burned their city to the ground.

articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.title: ‘I Hate Illinois Nazis’: GOP Tries, Fails to Stop Antisemite from Running Unopposed in Primary
articles.description: Holocaust denier and neo-Nazi Art Jones is running for Congress in Illinois -- and he is going to be the Republican nominee for the liberal third congressional district, over the objections of the Illinois Republican Party.

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Fashion Notes: Melania Trump Rocks Patriotic Varsity Jacket for Super Bowl
articles.description: First Lady Melania Trump wore her patriotism on her sleeve in a varsity jacket with electric blue stilettos as she attended a Super Bowl LII party in Palm Beach, Florida at Mar-a-Lago with President Donald Trump.

articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.title: GOP Rep Peter King: More Evidence of Russia Collusion with Hillary Than with Trump
articles.description: Sunday, Rep. Peter King (R-NY) argued that there is more evidence of Russian collusion in the 2016 election with the Hillary Clinton campaign than with the President Donald Trump campaign. “I’ve been involved with this now for the last 18 months. I have not s…

articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.title: Philly Coach Doug Pederson Praises ‘Lord and Savior Jesus Christ’ During Post-Game Celebration
articles.description: The Philadelphia Eagles took down the reigning champs Sunday with a thrilling 41-33 victory over New England. Following the game, Eagles coach Doug Pederson proclaimed his faith and thanked Jesus Christ for the opportunity. “How do you explain this, that nine…

articles.author: Warner Todd Huston
articles.title: Odell Beckham Jr., Eli Manning Are ‘Having the Time of Their Lives’ in Super Bowl Ad
articles.description: Odell Beckham Jr. and Eli Manning gave Jennifer Grey and the late Patrick Swayze a run for their money with a hilarious NFL ad as Super Bowl LII came into its final minutes.

articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.title: Watch: Redskins QB Kirk Cousins Stars in Local DC Commercial with Fake Donald Trump
articles.description: Washington Redskins quarterback Kirk Cousins made an appearance Sunday during Super Bowl LII. Cousins, likely to be on his way out of Washington this offseason after the Redskins acquired Alex Smith from the Kansas City Chiefs, starred in a local Washington D…

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Kris Kobach: Memo ‘Almost Identical to Watergate’ but ‘Ten Times Bigger’
articles.description: Kansas Secretary of State and gubernatorial candidate Kris Kobach says the memo released by the House Intelligence Committee is "almost identical to Watergate" but "ten times bigger."

articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.title: Watch: Eagles Score on Amazing Trick Play
articles.description: The Philadelphia Eagles drew up a trick play Sunday just before halftime to go up 22-12 over the New England Patriots. On 4th and goal from just beyond the one-yard line, Eagles coach Doug Pederson dialed up a direct snap to runningback Corey Clement, who han…

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Trump on Countries Refusing Their Nationals: ‘We’ll Tariff Their Goods, They’ll Take Them Back in Two Seconds’
articles.description: President Donald Trump says he is committed to sanctioning and placing tariffs on foreign countries who refuse to take back their nationals after being deported from the United States.

articles.author: Warner Todd Huston
articles.title: Americans Turning Off Super Bowl in Droves: Bars, Bowling Alleys, Veterans Boycotting
articles.description: More Americans than ever have decided to ignore the NFL's biggest game by finding other things to do than to tune in and watch Super Bowl LII and most cite the NFL's refusal to stand to honor the country during the playing of the national anthem as their reas…

articles.author: Breitbart News
articles.title: No Players Kneel or Raise Fists During the National Anthem at Super Bowl LII
articles.description: No players from New England and Philadelphia were kneeling or sitting during the national anthem before the Super Bowl.

articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.title: Former FBI Assistant Director: ‘Deeply Disappointing’ That Clinton Email Investigator Was Evading Federal Record-Keeping Laws Himself
articles.description: “To me it is deeply disappointing that two FBI senior officials are engaging in this sort of discussion,” said Ron Hosko, former assistant director of the Criminal Investigative Division at FBI Headquarters, commenting on FBI officials discussing evasion of f…

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: U.S. Garment Workers Get Wage Raises as Stricter Immigration Enforcement Tightens Labor Market
articles.description: American garment workers are reaping the benefits of President Trump's economic nationalism which seeks to tighten the labor market to increase U.S. wages.

articles.author: Warner Todd Huston
articles.title: NFL Includes Convicted Murderer Aaron Hernandez in Pre-Super Bowl ‘In Memoriam’ Video
articles.description: As part of its pre-game festivities, the NFL treated fans to a video in memory of those players who passed away in 2017. Perhaps shockingly, that video included convicted murderer Aaron Hernandez.
